label: Google Sheets
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for Google Sheets.

tools.name: AddNoteToCell
tools.description:
Add a note to a specific cell in a spreadsheet. A note is a small
piece of text attached to a cell (shown with a black triangle) that
appears when you hover over the cell.

sheet_id_or_name takes precedence over sheet_position. If a sheet is not mentioned,
then always assume the default sheet_position is sufficient.

parameters.name: spreadsheet_id
parameters.description: The id of the spreadsheet to add a comment to

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: The column string to add a note to. For example, 'A', 'F', or 'AZ'

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: The row number to add a note to

parameters.name: note_text
parameters.description: The text for the note to add

parameters.name: sheet_position
parameters.description: The position/tab of the sheet in the spreadsheet to write to. A value of 1 represents the first (leftmost/Sheet1) sheet. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: sheet_id_or_name
parameters.description: The id or name of the sheet to write to. If provided, takes precedence over sheet_position.

note_text.value: This is a note regarding the data in this cell.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateSpreadsheet
tools.description:
Create a new spreadsheet with the provided title and data in its first sheet

Returns the newly created spreadsheet's id and title

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the new spreadsheet

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to write to the spreadsheet. A JSON string (property names enclosed in double quotes) representing a dictionary that maps row numbers to dictionaries that map column letters to cell values. For example, data[23]['C'] would be the value of the cell in row 23, column C. Type hint: dict[int, dict[str, Union[int, float, str, bool]]]

output.description: The created spreadsheet's id and title

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GenerateGoogleFilePickerUrl
tools.description:
Generate a Google File Picker URL for user-driven file selection and authorization.

This tool generates a URL that directs the end-user to a Google File Picker interface where
where they can select or upload Google Drive files. Users can grant permission to access their
Drive files, providing a secure and authorized way to interact with their files.

This is particularly useful when prior tools (e.g., those accessing or modifying
Google Docs, Google Sheets, etc.) encountered failures due to file non-existence
(Requested entity was not found) or permission errors. Once the user completes the file
picker flow, the prior tool can be retried.

Suggest this tool to users when they are surprised or confused that the file they are
searching for or attempting to access cannot be found.

output.description: Google File Picker URL for user file selection and permission granting

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSpreadsheet
tools.description:
Gets the specified range of cells from a single sheet in the spreadsheet.

sheet_id_or_name takes precedence over sheet_position. If a sheet is not mentioned,
then always assume the default sheet_position is sufficient.

parameters.name: spreadsheet_id
parameters.description: The id of the spreadsheet to get

parameters.name: sheet_position
parameters.description: The position/tab of the sheet in the spreadsheet to get. A value of 1 represents the first (leftmost/Sheet1) sheet . Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: sheet_id_or_name
parameters.description: The id or name of the sheet to get. Defaults to None, which means sheet_position will be used instead.

parameters.name: start_row
parameters.description: Starting row number (1-indexed, defaults to 1)

parameters.name: start_col
parameters.description: Starting column letter(s) or 1-based column number (defaults to 'A')

parameters.name: max_rows
parameters.description: Maximum number of rows to fetch for each sheet in the spreadsheet. Must be between 1 and 1000. Defaults to 1000.

parameters.name: max_cols
parameters.description: Maximum number of columns to fetch for each sheet in the spreadsheet. Must be between 1 and 100. Defaults to 100.

output.description: The spreadsheet properties and data for the specified sheet in the spreadsheet

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSpreadsheetMetadata
tools.description:
Gets the metadata for a spreadsheet including the metadata for the sheets in the spreadsheet.

Use this tool to get the name, position, ID, and URL of all sheets in a spreadsheet as well as
the number of rows and columns in each sheet.

Does not return the content/data of the sheets in the spreadsheet - only the metadata.
Excludes spreadsheets that are in the trash.

parameters.name: spreadsheet_id
parameters.description: The id of the spreadsheet to get metadata for

output.description: The spreadsheet metadata for the specified spreadsheet

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchSpreadsheets
tools.description:
Searches for spreadsheets in the user's Google Drive based on the titles and content and
returns the title, ID, and URL for each matching spreadsheet.

Does not return the content/data of the sheets in the spreadsheets - only the metadata.
Excludes spreadsheets that are in the trash.

parameters.name: spreadsheet_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must be in the spreadsheet title. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: spreadsheet_not_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must NOT be in the spreadsheet title. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: search_only_in_shared_drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shared drive to restrict the search to. If provided, the search will only return spreadsheets from this drive. Defaults to None, which searches across all drives.

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: Whether to include spreadsheets from shared drives. Defaults to False (searches only in the user's 'My Drive').

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_spreadsheets
parameters.description: Whether to include spreadsheets from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide spreadsheets in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order. Defaults to listing the most recently modified spreadsheets first. If spreadsheet_contains or spreadsheet_not_contains is provided, then the order_by will be ignored.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of spreadsheets to list. Defaults to 10. Max is 50

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: The pagination token to continue a previous request

output.description: A dictionary containing the title, ID, and URL for each matching spreadsheet. Also contains a pagination token if there are more spreadsheets to list.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateCells
tools.description:
Write values to a Google Sheet using a flexible data format.

sheet_id_or_name takes precedence over sheet_position. If a sheet is not mentioned,
then always assume the default sheet_position is sufficient.

parameters.name: spreadsheet_id
parameters.description: The id of the spreadsheet to write to

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to write. A JSON string (property names enclosed in double quotes) representing a dictionary that maps row numbers to dictionaries that map column letters to cell values. For example, data[23]['C'] is the value for cell C23. This is the same format accepted by create_spreadsheet. Type hint: dict[int, dict[str, int | float | str | bool]]

parameters.name: sheet_position
parameters.description: The position/tab of the sheet in the spreadsheet to write to. A value of 1 represents the first (leftmost/Sheet1) sheet. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: sheet_id_or_name
parameters.description: The id or name of the sheet to write to. If provided, takes precedence over sheet_position.

output.description: The status of the operation, including updated ranges and counts

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description:
Get comprehensive user profile and Google Sheets environment information.

This tool provides detailed information about the authenticated user including
their name, email, profile picture, Google Sheets access permissions, and other
important profile details from Google services.

output.description: Get comprehensive user profile and Google Sheets environment information.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: WriteToCell
tools.description: Write a value to a single cell in a spreadsheet.

parameters.name: spreadsheet_id
parameters.description: The id of the spreadsheet to write to

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: The column string to write to. For example, 'A', 'F', or 'AZ'

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: The row number to write to

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to write to the cell

parameters.name: sheet_name
parameters.description: The name of the sheet to write to. Defaults to 'Sheet1'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
Arcade.dev provides LLM tools for Google Sheets, enabling seamless interactions with spreadsheet data through API integration. This toolkit allows developers to automate tasks, manage files, and enhance user experience in Google Sheets.

### Capabilities
- Create and manage spreadsheets with flexible data formats.
- Retrieve and update cell contents efficiently.
- Access user profile information and permissions.
- Generate file picker URLs for user-driven file selection and authorization.

### OAuth
- **Provider**: Google  
- **Scopes**:  
  - `https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file`  
  - `https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email`  
  - `https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profile`

### Secrets
- No secret types or names are specified.
